results.title: September 11 news footage
results.brief_description: The world held its breath as two hijacked planes were crashed into the World Trade Center in New York City on 11 September 2001. TV networks around the world bore witness and millions of people saw the historic event unfold in real time.
results.description: The world held its breath as two hijacked planes were crashed into the World Trade Center in New York City on 11 September 2001. TV networks around the world bore witness and millions of people saw the historic event unfold in real time.

results.title: Sentinel: the west face
results.creator_credit: Roger C. Brown and Summit Films
results.brief_description: A breath-taking record of two men scaling Sentinel Rock in Yosemite National Park. Also presents a verbal commentary on the practical “hows” of mountain-climbing and its philosophical “why”. All mountains are merely rocks, the film tells us and “a wall is simply the imagination’s refusal to cope with a rock so large. The rock is here and now. It asks total commitment. For most good climbers this was given years ago when a choice was required. Now it is automatic.” The ascent becomes no longer physical displacement from bottom to top, but a kind of ballet of human expression, “as individual as a name or a signature”.

results.title: Sentencing: the attainment of justice
results.creator_credit: Geoff Russell, Peter Wiseman and Video Classroom
results.brief_description: This video uncovers the often mysterious and unapproachable work of our senior lawmakers: the Attorney General, Magistrates and Judges who have the ultimate say over the severity of criminal sanctions. The program also goes inside the most notorious institutions such as HM Prison Pentridge, to give a unique and first-hand account into the sentencing and punishment of criminals.

results.title: Sent by God
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: the return from Egypt of Mary, Joseph and the Child; Jesus’ bar mitzvah in the synagogue; Jesus is lost and found among the doctor’s in the temple; John preaches at Jordan; the Zealots discuss John’s mission; Jesus is baptized by John; Andrew and Philip follow Jesus.

results.title: Sensitivity to antibiotic injections
results.brief_description: The possibility of contamination by antibiotics during an injection given by ordinary methods is shown. New procedures for giving antibiotic injections without risk to the doctor or nurse are then demonstrated.

results.title: Sense of taste
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Countless guidebooks to the epicurean delights of the Continent have obscured to many, the traditional delicacies of the British table and cellar. This film shows some of the delicacies which have made Britain famous; the haggis, kippers and whisky of Scotland, the York ham, Oxford marmalade and the Stilton cheeses of the towns and cities of provincial England. In London, at the “Cheshire Cheese” tavern in Fleet Street, visitors may partake of the celebrated “Pudding” - made with rump steak, kidneys and oysters and weighing some 60 pounds.

results.title: Sensation and perception
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Do our senses show us what is real or is reality merely a perceptual construction? This is a question which has challenged philosophers and psychologists alike since early times. Modern research shows that the senses filter reality, but that they can build a valid model of reality. Humans are very dependent on the sense of sight and the program looks closely at how vision works. Finally the influence of stress and other emotions on our perception of reality is explored.

results.title: Senka (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A young Yugoslavian woman with two small children is caught between her need for friendship and social contact at work, and the difficulties of finding someone to look after her children during the day. The ideal solution to the problem, Kindergarten, is not available to her.

results.title: Selling America. - [Ed. version]
results.creator_credit: General Motors and Jam Handy Organization
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of Benjamin Franklin’s principle of human association as applied to modern salesmanship. The following rules for successful selling are suggested: Get the prospect talking; don’t argue but be pleasant and helpful; agree with the customer, answering “yes…, but…”; don’t contradict and avoid being too positive; make the most use of time, bringing points of direct interest to the customer with other points about the product. An edited version.
